intro: Draba uruguayana, commonly known as the Uruguay dwarf cress, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Uruguay and Argentina. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is small, typically growing to a height of less than 10 centimeters, with basal leaves and small white or yellow flowers. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. Draba uruguayana is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
